comments.html: Microflow like per-flow policing is not supported in IOS, but with the new "Zone firewall" feature there is a per-class policer which could be handy.
comments.name: Gabriele Beltrame

comments.html:
@Gernot: this is a solution an end-customer can deploy to try to influence his downstream traffic.

The Service Provider always has the ability to rate-limit the virtual interface (which is usually better than relying on the ATM side of the DSL circuit to throw away extra cells).
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: @Gabrielle: you can always deploy per-class policer using MQC. The advantage of the "zone firewall" policer is that it works between groups of interfaces, not on inbound/outbound interface traffic.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
